meanings.definition: To come together for a common purpose or cause.
meanings.sent1: The team rallied to win the game.
meanings.sent2: The community rallied to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The students rallied to raise money for charity.
meanings.sent4: The birds rallied in the sky, forming a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The flowers rallied around the tree, creating a colorful display.

meanings.definition: To recover strength or spirits after a setback.
meanings.sent1: After feeling tired, she rallied and finished her homework.
meanings.sent2: He rallied quickly after the illness and returned to work.
meanings.sent3: The team rallied their energy to finish the race strong.
meanings.sent4: The sun rallied after the storm, shining brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The player rallied his focus and scored the winning goal.

meanings.definition: To bring together for support or encouragement.
meanings.sent1: The teacher rallied the students before the exam.
meanings.sent2: The family rallied around their loved one during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The community rallied to help rebuild the house after the fire.
meanings.sent4: The team rallied their spirits and won the championship.
meanings.sent5: The group rallied together, showing unity and strength.
